newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean shares end weaker but off day's lows.
newsitem.headline: Chilean shares end weaker but off day's lows.

text.p: Chilean stocks trimmed early losses to close a shade softer with the bourse bolstered by Wall Street's surge, said traders.
The market is expected to hold steady next week but much will depend on whether foreign investors continue the wave of bargain-hunting seen earlier this week, they said.
"The market should hover at these levels but this will depend on the flow of orders from abroad," said one trader.
The 40-share index, which had lost close to one percent midsession, ended down 0.24 percent at 107.82 points. The general index shed 0.1 percent to 5,135.16 points.
Turnover dwindled to 12.6 billion pesos from 16 billion pesos Thursday and 22 billion pesos two days ago.

Traders noted that Chilean-issued American Depositary Receipts, which had opened sharply lower, recovered some ground on the rise in New York stocks following stronger-than-expected U.S. employment data.
Winners included Banco O'Higgins, up 2.42 percent at 1,690 pesos, pension fund manager Provida, up 2.22 percent at 9,200 pesos and winery Concha y Toro which firmed 1.5 percent to 203 pesos.
Losers included paper-maker CMPC, down 2.08 percent at 4,700 pesos, bottler Andina, down 1.35 percent at 2,190 pesos and steel-maker Cap which shed 1.07 percent to 925 pesos.
